channel.title: System Logs on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in System Logs on Analyst

item.title: AWS Logs
item.description: This document is devoted to AWS logs. Several examples are analysed and useful fields are marked.

item.title: Android Logs
item.description: logcat command of adb is used to get system log. It’s an equivalent to Ubuntu syslog, as far as I understand.

item.title: iOS Logs
item.description: Same as for macOS. On iOS - /private/var/.fseventsd, for System: /.fseventsd and Developer Patch at /DeveloperPatch/.

item.title: macOS Logs
item.description: Syslog syslog. Since macOS Sierra (10.12, 2016) Apple has redesigned its log system. Unix logs were replaced (syslog, for example).

item.title: Windows Registry
item.description: Windows registry stores two types of data: settings and logs. These are not usual logs, like event logs, but rather some stats or recent activity snapshots.

item.title: Linux Logs
item.description: /var/log üêß /etc/rsyslog.conf - see the log owners, what specific logs are logging and where the additional configurations are stored.
